item.title: About Me
item.description: body{ /* Normal */ font-size: 20px; } I’m social psychologist who studies social interactions and emotions and uses dynamic systems and advanced quantitative modeling in his research. I received my Ph.D. in social psychology from Arizona State University in 2017. I use multiple research methods, including mobile sensing (e.g. audio recording, accelerometer, PMG), behavioral coding, natural language processing, economic decision-making games, and peripher psychophysiology to answer research questions.
